column4: hi guys, where's stored the info of the partition mount???? :s
i changed a few settings and now don't mount
i want to rollback
I think you want "/etc/fstab"
no no, it's an external usb disk, i plugged it in, change a few setting on the Volume Properties, and when try to remount it fails
so i want to rollback that changes
how did you "change a few setting on the Volume Properties"?
right click on the mounted device => properties => Volume
so what did you change?
the fmask and dmask
i think it's gnome-volume who manage these setting right?
where can i delete my custom setting?
cant you do that in the same place that you changed them?
no, because i can't mount the device now, i right-clicked the icon of the mounted device in the desktop
but i already solved it :)
gnome-volume --erase-setting -d <your_device>
gawd sake man tell me how you did it! I need to know!!!
how i did what?
how you did  gnome-volume --erase-setting -d <your_device> ;)\
command-line
/jk
